Just need to chmod the folder right? Dont need to chmod every file?
Check the permissions on one of the files. I believe the command for changing the permissions on folder and files within them are chmod -R uga+rwx/777 /dir/to/

I like to use ugoa+rwx instead of 777 as I can never remember the values, so in your case, the command would be: sudo chmod -R u+rwx /srv/samba. If you don't know what that means, ask me, and I'll explain.
-R = recursive, includes all files and sub-folders and files in sub-folders. u = user, you +rwx = Read,Write,eXecute. And of course the folder you wish to perform the operation on.
